metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7791 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
On pages containing an iframe, the "data:" protocol can be used to create a modal alert that will render over arbitrary domains following page navigation, spoofing of the origin of the modal alert from the iframe content. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 52.3, Firefox ESR < 52.3, and Firefox < 55.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7791` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs38 contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
